title: Screen on 3 XL I've had for months suddenly developed a yellowish tint this morning.
content:
I bought my Pixel 3 XL new shortly after they came on the market, and I've never had a problem with the display. I'm also by now very much accustomed to how the display looks. I went out for breakfast this morning, and there was nothing unusual about it. When I got home, I noticed that there was a yellowish tinge to the display. I had not installed anything--though I believe there was a system update that came through shortly after.

I have, of course, tried restart the phone, as well as powering it off and back on, but I'm not seeing the display restored to normal. On the other hand, when I restart, the white screen that appears at the beginning of the process, with the animated Google logo, is white, as it should be. When I get to the home page, the time display looks white for a brief moment and then rapidly transitions to the yellowish tinge.

The screen isn't less legible: it just doesn't look right. What's the fix?
